revised_title: Observations on a Monstrous Calf and Human Ear Anatomy
tldr: Dr. Archibald Adams describes a monstrous calf and provides detailed observations on the anatomy of a human ear. He discusses the role of the eardrum and the bones within the ear, as well as the membranes that cover and protect them. Adams also compares the structure of the ear to a drum, highlighting the similarities between the natural and artificial versions.
